content: this acorn amigurumi crochet pattern is perfect as a little fall companion alan the acorn is full of autumn charm this is an intermediate-level pattern made using light worsted/dk weight yarn while all the details are listed below here s a quick overview this acorn amigurumi involves one minor colour change working in the round sometimes continuous sometimes chaining and turning your work and a puff if you re comfortable with crocheting in the round as well as chaining and turning your work even confident beginners can make this cutie minimal sewing is also a bonus with only 5 pieces to crochet as the acorn step top and bottom is made in one go you ll then need to crochet two arms and two legs sew these on and you re done the pattern is free to view on my blog here 1 but if you d prefer a printable ad-free pdf version it s available to purchase in my ravelry store materials needed ---------------- * **yarn ** dk/light worsted weight yarn i recommend rico design ricorumi dk 100% cotton or 100% cotton yarn hello dk cotton petite ball in the following colours dark brown 18grams = 45m/49 2yds and light brown 25grams = 57 5m/62 9yds * **crochet hook ** crochet hook 2 5mm or c in us terms is a suitable alternative * **other materials ** stuffing needle scissors pins stitch marker safety eyes 6mm black embroidery thread scrap white and pink dk yarn for eye and cheek embroidery details acorn amigurumi size -------------------- using the yarn and hooks specified in this amigurumi acorn crochet pattern my creation was 9cm/3 5 wide by 16 5cm/6 5 high gauge ----- gauge is not required for this pattern however keep gauge consistent throughout for reference my gauge was as follows 7 single_crochet stitches on 2 5cm / 1 8 row on 2 5cm / 1 additional information ---------------------- * **pattern language ** english * **pattern terms ** us terms * **stitches used ** magic_ring chain slip_stitch single_crochet puff with 7-loops increases and decreases * **yarn the yarn choice is completely up to you and you can change the yarn colours weight and material based on your own personal preference just be aware that the weight of your yarn may impact the hook size you need to use and the size of your final make * **hook size ** i recommend using a smaller hook size than recommended on the yarn label this will stop the stuffing from appearing through your stitches * **eyes ** please note that safety eyes are a choking hazard and are not suitable for children under 3 years of age as an alternative use an embroidered eye * **working in rounds ** all parts within this pattern are worked in continuous rounds unless otherwise stated * **stitch marker ** use a stitch marker at the beginning of each round to keep track of the number of stitches * **stuffing ** unless otherwise stated stuff all amigurumi
